comments:
Build: 2001-11-16

Open the Navigator view
Expand the org.eclipse.ui project
Expand Eclipse UI folder
Expand org folder
Expand eclipse folder
Expand ui folder
Select IActionBars.java file
Select rename from the context menu
Press esc key to cancel editing
Collapse the tree at org.eclipse.ui project level

You should get an internal error message about a widget being disposed. I've 
included the .log content below. It seems the editor is being sent setVisible 
but it is already disposed.

-------------------

Log: Tue Nov 27 13:49:34 EST 2001
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Tue Nov 27 13:49:34 EST 2001
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 Widget is disposed
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1877)

(InternalBootLoader.java:820)

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:151)

Must investigate if this problem is in TreeEditor (SWT) or RenameResourceAction.
*** Bug 6358 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The problem was that when the editor was added to was added to a local var 
rather than the field of the ResourceRenameAction and hence was inaccessible 
when it was being disposed.

Fixed in build > 20011127.

NOTE: This was a problem introduced in the 2.0 stream and does not affect the 
1.0 stream.
*** Bug 6118 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
